content.detailedDescription: Diamond like or star like. friend called to say what he was seeing in the sky, i went out side to look at them. the time was around 11:00 am when i first saw, then noticed an erregular flight pattern, father saw the same thing, all of us are a couple of blocks from each other. they made u-turns and zig zags. to surreal to have feelings about what we saw. none of us were excited. after a half hour the ufo's vanished into the clouds. sorry, no pics.
content.summary: Circling in sky near sun, going east and west almost straight up in sky.

content.detailedDescription:
My parents, my fiance and i were sitting around our firepit in our yard at approximately 8pm saturday, september 19, 2009. my mom was facing the southern sky and said quite calmly, "what is that in the sky?"  we all looked directly into the southern sky, up high, not low or near the horizon, and saw a very bright light in a cone shaped pattern, narrow at the top and wide near the bottom, hard to say how big, but larger that what you would expect for an airplanes landing lights.  which is of course what we thought it was at first, but it was very, very bright, then just slowly faded to nothing-gone.  did not move at all, in any direction at any time.  we never could see what was producing the light, there weren't any other lights with it, such as navigational red and green lights as on an airplane.  the entire episode lasted probably about 1 to 2 minutes, from first noticeing it to it fading away.  did anyone else see anything similar? i would love to know, there is much debate among the four of us, but we do agree, to us it is an "unidentified flying/hovering object".

sorry no photos! no one thought of it, nor did any of us have a camera anywhere nearby.
content.summary: Bright stationary light shining down from an undiciperable object in cone shape pattern that just faded from sight without movement.

content.detailedDescription:
I was participating with friends in a nightsky photography workshop at acadia national park. there were 15 adults: 12 participants, 2 park service employees to drive van and assist, plus tyler nordgren,phd astronomer and artist, teaching the workshop. after an introduction and instructions, we all set up our cameras on the edge of eagle lake, most of us aiming southwest hoping to capture the milky way as the evening progressed. (the workshop was scheduled from 6:30-9:00pm et.)

at approximately 7:50pm et, we all observed a bright object that appeared suddenly directly in front of us. it seemed to come down in the sky, burn brightly creating a cone of light shining towards the ground much like a streetlight and fog-like light around it. the "streetlight" did not make it the ground. after a few seconds, the object disappeared. the fog and "streetlight" slowly disappeared after about 45 seconds. it just seemed to fade from the cone shape to a smudge in the sky.

at least 3 participants' cameras captured the event. (a series of 3 photos are attached, hopefully.) not knowing where else to share such an event, we are posting it here. a description of photography workshop can be found here:
http://www.Nightskyfestival.Org/festival/home_.Html
content.summary: During acadia nightsky photography workshop, an unidentified bright object appeared and then disappeared.

content.detailedDescription:
We were driving down benstein a road in walled lake michigan it was about 9:00pm and we saw a formation of about 7 reddish orange lights hovering in the sky like  if the big dipper just came down
it was so noticable.
we pulled down a astreet to see if qwe could see them better. we lost sight of them for a few minutes and there was a tree kind of blocking are sight. them i saw them again, they were strange orange lights,glowing and kind of teardrop shaped, they were not airplains or helicoptors. they were flying around and kind of staying in this one area.
i decided to get back in the car and drive further down to get beyond the trees to get a better look. i lost sight of them for a few minutes and i thought they were gone. all of sudden one went strait up in the air, it looked like a ball of fire,it went straight up and them headed north, we jumped back in the car and followed it.
we had it in sight for  alittle while and then it just disappeared.
i wondered if someone was sending something up in the air? but it was fire, it looked like fire, i dont know what ou could send up in the air
that would look like that.
it literally looked like it was burning, when we saw it up close.
i was freaking out and my son was so scared he was crying, it was the strangest thing i have ever seen and i cant explain what we saw.
i called the police dept to see if anyone else reported seeing anything. they said no one had. i watched the news and didnt see anything. i dont know how no one else saw them. the formation was as plain as day and i dont know how someone else driving down benstein behind me didnt see them.
content.summary: A formation of about  7 orange-red lights

content.detailedDescription: I was at a get together with friends near big mountain road in shamokin, pa.  it was 7:50 pm on saturday september 19th, 2009.  a large light appeared at what seemed a very high altitude in the sky south east of shamokin.  after what seemed to be a matter of a few seconds this glowing light emitted a spotlight that lit up the sky below the craft. the craft then, what i can describe as blinking out of existince, disapeared. the spotlight resonated for a few seconds after the ball of light was gone.  there was no sound and a cloudless sky.  i feel very priveleged to witness what i did.  there are approx. 10 other witnesses to this event that were present at the time.  i don't know of anyone else in town seeing it as of yet because it happened only yesterday.  i emailed the local newspaper about this event and have not yet received a response.
content.summary: Group of about 10 ppl witnessed a large ball of light appear, light shines down, object dissapears light resonates

content.detailedDescription: I went out to get the morning paper about 0630. the sun was still behind the mountain and i could see another star in the east. looking to the north was a very bright "star". this is the first time i've seen this prior to today. i went into the house to get my binocs. and when viewed, the object looked balloon shaped. it did not appear to be moving. after about five minutes two smaller lights desended from the "star" and created a vertical line of now three equal size lights. as the sun continued to rise the daylight washed out the object. i took a pic with my camera when first seen, but have no reference point. just a bright dot in the sky. the sky was cloudless and clear. i have never seen a ufo, and living in albuquerque could tell this was not a hot air balloon.
content.summary: Bright light in morning sky turning into three smaller lights.

content.detailedDescription:
I am filing this on behalf of my mother and father who do not have a computer. there names are listed on this report and they are happy to receive a call to discuss this siting further.

my parents were at their vacation home in berkeley springs, wv. they were looking in the sky for comets and planets, like they usually do. the sky was very clear last night. they saw an object in the sky. it was a large, bright, white, circular light. the object seemed to hover. they watched it for a few seconds and the object began to emit a misty cone shape light beneath it. this lasted a few more seconds. they report the light disappeared into the object and object suddenly shot straight up into the sky at a very fast speed and disappeared. they heard no sound during this event.
content.summary: Bright white object emitting cone shaped light

content.detailedDescription: Approx 8 pm - approx 58 degrees  - i was located in lutherville at a friends birthday party when i looked up towards the eastern sky, towards direction of whitemarsh/parkville, and saw a bright white light appear. we were in his backyard grilling at the time. the light appeared to evolve from darkness, not like a light you turn on by switch, but it grew brighter (holding in elevation at the time). the light source was circular in shape and projected light in a cone shape straight downward. light was similar to a helicopter spotlight (electrictronically enduced spotlight - not a flame, not a fire, but manufactured). there was no sound associted with this light or smoke. a large plume of smoke was below the lighted object- fog like - like a street light in the fog, except massive. the light was as bright as jet aircraft landing apprroach lights, if not brighter. the light source began to slowly lower in elevation approx 500 ft? ?...Light began to slowly go out (still holding at the same elevation it seemed (like it did not travel away or up). the large area of fog smoke below object remained lighted for approx 10 seconds then faded to black. visibilty this night was clear, no clouds. shortly their after all the smoke was gone, commercial aircraft flew by where the sighting occured around same elevation. aircraft headed south. i have studied aviation since childhood and seen rockets, hovering helicopters, harrier jets in air shows, and nothing compares to what i saw this night. the fact that there was no sound associated with this event leaves me to belive that it was not military/commercial aircraft. as noted, a commercial ailiner passed by site approx 10-30 seconds after event (right where sighting was in sky) and jet's engine noise could be clearly heard at this distance.  i had felt that i had seen something that was man made, but not normal. i called 911 around 8:15 and reported incident annonamously, i was told it was probably fireworks occuring at towson university - not possible. i asked that if they had been flooded with callers, and operator said that they had not as of yet. three people at the party also saw event.
content.summary: Hovering circle - bright light - projected light cone, around 5,000 ft estimated

content.detailedDescription: What first appeared to be the search light from a helicopter was actually more comet like on close inspection..Though it seemed much closer. the cone shaped light seemed to shower down from a bright spot at the apex of the cone. i began to consider if it was a search light from a craft, falling space debris, a comet, or an alien portal. then the light blinked out and the cone of light started to very slowly vanish/dissipate/dissolve/fade from the apex to the base which still had a very distinct outline though it was fading in intensity of light. when the light began to fade i thought it was a cloud obscuring the object/light, but again closer inspection showed it was murky/hazy from the city lights/pollution, yet still clear of obscuring clouds...Though i can't be 100% sure of that detail. i have read one report from the other side of the state that was exactlyish the same. that report cited other sightings of this event in virginia at about the same time last night. the position of the light was directly overhead in my experience, and they said that it was in western sky i believe. also i am pretty sure that it was 7:48 at the latest, and this sighting report from eastern maryland said 7:55pm. the apex of the triangle/cone shape pointed to the west and the light did not seem to move at all. i am sure that i will not be the last to report this sighting.
content.summary: White comet like cone lasts for only 30 seconds and disappears in a slow diming vanish.

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting outside at a bomb fire. i looked up and pointed, then my 5 friends all saw the same thing.  a bright light that looked like a star with a cone shaped light coming out from the star, looked as if it were coming down to earth.  the star disapeared about 30 seconds after we saw it, the cone stayed but slowly disapeared. this all lasted maybe 2 or 3 minutes at the most! it was too quick for us to get a picture once we thought of it.  it appeared as a foggy cloud but when it disapeared we realized there were no clouds in the sky at all.  the light we saw was much higher then any airplane would travel.  it was not and airplane. after wards we heard of 6 other people in our county who saw the same thing!
content.summary: Small star-like light with a cone of light shooting out from underneath.  "star" dissapeared then the cone slowly dissapeared.

content.detailedDescription:
I went out to pick up a pizza last night at 750 pm and when i got out of my truck i noticed a white light shining down from a cone shaped mist  there didnt seem to be any movement  i was looking south over the top of the building at about 30 to 35 degrees it was a perfectly clear sky i watched the light for about 30 seconds before it just faded out 

at first i thought it looked like a spotlite shining down but then i realized there was no sound and that it looked as if shining thru a mist nearest i can compare it to is a rocket shooting up and the mist looked like the trail but the light was white not orange  there was no sound and i couldnt see any movement so i assume the object was very distant  then it just faded away no sign of anything not even the mist
content.summary: Cone shaped mist with white light shining down

content.detailedDescription:
To begin i have to say that never in my life would i have thought twice about reporting a ufo event. i've always thought the subject interesting but i never gave any of it much thought. that was before last night.

my family and i were driving home from a dinner with my grandparents. it was dark with many stars in the sky. i was listening to my ipod when my brother said that there was something weird in the sky. this was at 8:50 pm (atlantic time, 7:50pm eastern). everyone in my family including myself was transfixed on this light emanating from the sky. at first i thought it was a search helicopter or so but at a second glance i realized how far up it was and the light was too intense. there were no sounds that would have indicated it was a helicopter. the source of light began with the point in the sky and broaden as it descended to earth. it had a cone shape. also unlike a helicopter this light did not move. it was completely still which gave the eerie sense that it was not of human creation. then all of a sudden the light disappeared in a fog (remember that there was not a cloud in the sky). the whole time this event was occurring my heart was racing with excitement that maybe i had seen a ufo. the one thing i can say apart from the evidence is that my gut feeling the whole was telling me that it was a ufo. many would call me crazy, but i'm sure of this.
content.summary: Cone of light. disappeared in fog.

content.detailedDescription:
My mother and i arrive in wellfleet for a weeks vacation. sitting outside looking west / north west at the water having a glass of wine. the sun has set the stars are out there is not a cloud in the sky. she looks up towards west / nw and says 'what is that'.  there is a bright ball of light that opens from a ball into a light shinning from above downwards toward land in a cone shape,(it didn't shine to earth but half way towards the bay - but not reflecting on teh water etc) it then seems to close as if the 2 sides of the cone come together and it leaves a image of light which looks like it's soft muted in the shape of a image of a ghost a kid would draw in kindergarten, with a head, marshmellow arms, and a bell skirt.  it sways from left to right for about 4-5 minutes until it completely disapates.  
i was in awe, and wonder, mom was very frightened.  i called the local police who said they'd had a call, but there was a light show - and then they just said thank you for your call.  this light didn't come from the earth up, it came from above down - and the light only showed down from the source, not above it.  additionally, we are in a bay with no one else or sounds around us and we didn't hear any sounds or noises at all of any kind what so ever. 
we called a friend who's a colonel in the marines but couldn't get through and we called my sister.

this is a first for either of us and would love to hear if anyone else saw anything similar!
content.summary: Bright light 10-20,000 feet in sky, then a cone shinning from the sky downward dissapated to fuzzy light dancing

content.detailedDescription:
I was at a friend's house near hill road in shickshinny, pa.  i was sitting in my car, which was on top of a hill facing south towards jonestown mountain, when a friend of mine noticed the object and asked us to look at it.  i got out of my car at 7:52 pm et, so i didn't see how it first appeared.  

there was a central circular object, very bright and larger than a star, casting a triangular beam light directly down towards the ground. this circle/light lasted in full strength, with no movement, sound, or flashing, for about 30 seconds.  then the light seemed to shrink in its own fog (whereas the rest of the night sky was completely clear) until it completely disappeared.  this disappearance occurred over the course of a minute.  

three of us saw this object and were stunned by its presence.  none of us even thought to take a picture with our cell phones.  we just watched to see what would happen next, and yelled to our friends to come see it, although they didn't hear us over their music.
content.summary: Central circular bright light casting a downward triangular foggy beam, then dissipating into its own fog for almost the next minute

content.detailedDescription:
From my phone log, i refine my sighting (#19443) time from 19:50 to 19:45.

a more recent case speculates that what we all saw was the international space station.

nasa's website provides times and directions that one can view the iss.  i went to the site(http://spaceflight.Nasa.Gov/realdata/sightings/cities/view.Cgi?Country=united_states&region=virginia&city=falls_church) and compared the data to my own observations and they don't match.

nasa's data is as follows: sat sep 19/09:05 pm < 1 11 10 above nnw 11 above n.

nasa says that the sighting should have occured at 21:05; mine was at 19:45.

nasa said that the max elevation of the sighting should have been 11 degrees; mine was approximately 30.

nasa said that the approach angle would be 10 degrees above nnw and the departure direction would be 11 degrees above n; my sighting was se and stationary.

based on nasa's data, i don't have a great degree of confidence that it was the iss.
content.summary: Ammendment to 19443; not sure of iss theory.

content.detailedDescription: At around 8pm, myself and two friends were standing outside in the one of said friends yards.  we were talking about who knows what when friend 1 says "what the f*** is that?"  friend 2 and myself turned to see a brilliant white star/ball/sphere/dot in the sky.  it appeared to be above the trees and off to the south of us.  it had a cone of light shining towards the ground much like a streetlight and fog-like light around it.  the "streetlight" did not make it the ground but instead faded out above the trees.  after about 10 seconds the star/ball/sphere/dot disappeared.  the fog and "streetlight"  slowly disappeared after about 45 seconds.  it just seemed to fade from the cone shape to a smudge in the sky.  i don't know what it was but i have never in my life seen light that brilliant or light fade out or drift off like smoke.
content.summary: Bright white sphere and cone of light.

content.detailedDescription: I stood facing east or south east from a friend's yard looking over the  clear horizen. about 7:55 pm i looked back as my friend was exiting his house, i then repostioned my eyes from once they were and saw a glow of a white triangle coming down from venus. at that point, a neighbor who was sitting on his porch down the street got up in atsonishment from what i could tell, as he then went back inside and appearently told his family as they then came out with him to view the sky. the light lasted for about 30 seconds to a minute, the source looked like it venus but i noticed a small source of light vanished below ,that point i knew it wasnt venus ,the glow faded in another 10-20 seconds into the night time sky. from that point i just tried walking around to calm my excitment and gather my thoughts and just reply the event to find any faults or what it could've been. later on, i looked up fellow reports such as these on mufon and local news to discover that many reports matched my experience. which surprised me that people from virginia and the state new york also witnessed this. which also prooved it wasn't just a cloud but either a ufo or an atmoshperic event. anycase, it was very interesting.
content.summary: Cone shaped object over eastern part of maryland.

content.detailedDescription:
My family and i (including my mother) were sitting on our back deck enjoying a campfire and looking at the stars.  it was somewhere right around 9 pm and my son said "momma, look up at that light".  we looked up to see what looked almost like a helicopter search light only a lot bigger and it was coming from a large ball of white light. my husband is a private pilot and i know from flying with him for over 20 years, that was this was not a plane or helicopter.  there were no emergency lights, nothing, and this was higher than a helicopter could fly and much bigger.  it hovered for about a minute or so and then started to go straight up in the sky.  it left behind a misty type light as it ascended but there wasn't a cloud in the sky!  this object did not make any noise either, it was dead silent.

i posted my story on facebook to friends and have had several responses back that other people in several nearby towns saw what we did tonight.  i would love to know if anyone else out there saw it or if there was a documented flight mission, etc over our area that could explain it.  
never in my life have i seen anything like this.  if anyone would like to contact me, they are free to do so.  i am excited to hear stories of anyone who saw what i did tonight.  

sincerely,

lisa perry
content.summary: Large, round ball of white light that had what looked like a spot light shining down on the mountain.

content.detailedDescription:
So around 8 o'clock tonight i was working with the children i nanny.

we had gotten back from dinner, i put the rental movie in the dvd player and went out to my car to look for the book i brought to read.

it was a crisp, clear september night in fairfield, ct with not a cloud in the sky and a million stars.

i looked all around the front and back seats and even checked in the trunk before i realized that i had left the book at home.

as i was walking back to the house, about three feet in front of the door, i happened to look up and stopped in my tracks.

about 150 feet above the treeline a bright circular orb of light hung in the air. it looked like a meteor but stopped in its tracks, really low to the ground and as bright as the moon would have been.

what was really strange was that it seemed to be emanating a fog just around that area. that was what first caught my attention, not the light, but this patch of fog, connected to nothing, 400 feet in the air.

underneath the orb, the fog was catching the light so a cone (like from a flashlight beam) appeared underneath the orb.

the orb started to descend until it cleared the patch of fog and was visible just by itself and then ascended up into the fog again. the fog was transparent enough that i could still plainly see it was an orb. it did this twice before finally pulling deeper into the mist so i couldn't make out any shape and it just backlit the mist.

(the way the moon looks when you can't see it at all but you can see its light in the clouds around it.)

i ran inside to tell the boys i nanny to come and look for maybe all of ten seconds, came out and it had vanished.

not only had it vanished but there wasn't any fog anywhere.

the sky was perfectly clear and there was no trace of where it had been.


it didn't make any sound. there were no colored lights. 
it moved very smoothly and specifically.
the fog remained after the light seemed to start pulling away from it.

the size of the planet venus is the equivalent i'll use and it looked like five or six of those combined. also, it was very bright.

i didn't actually see it disappear as i went inside.

it didn't look like a machine, a plane or any kind of craft. it looked like a big star that seemed to be moving vertically up and down.


i was never afraid, just really curious and trying to figure out what on earth it was. 

i've never seen anything like it in my life!
content.summary: An orb of light emanating a fog appeared in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: My friends and i were at a private beach in clinton ct and at about eight thirty  we saw a triangular glowing cloud like object in the sky below venus and in line with the milky way.  by the way this night is clear, no clouds at all.  it was the most wierd thing i have ever seen.  it was huge and at the top of the pyramid, there was a bright light.  the light was extremely white.  someone else brought up that it looked like the pyramid hotel in vegas but over long island sound.  it lasted for about a minute then faded away.  this may sound stupid, but if you saw it, you would have been amazed.  i have never seen anything like this in my life, and if anybody can explain this i would love to hear about it.  even our friend becky who was driving to the party  on interstate 95 saw the thing.  when it appeared there was regular aircraft traffic over li sound heading towards ny city but this was no airplane.  again it was a huge cloud like triangle with a white bright beacon on the top.  someone please explain this to me.
content.summary: Large triangle.

content.detailedDescription:
On september 8, 2009 after reading up the disclosure project site and watching an interview with steven greer on the matter, basically saying that now it is time for people initiate the contact themselves (instead of waiting for a government disclosure) using certain mind techniques. i have telepathically asked for a contact and wanted to see not just a star like object (which i have seen 4-5 times this summer) but a giant et ship, so no doubt is left. i needed a confirmation of my previous sighting, as well. so i was sending focused mental messages through out a day. 

around 9 p.M. i heard some strange movement (best way i can describe it) outside the window. i had an urge to go check what was going on. when i walked out and looked up i saw a giant mother-ship type "ufo" (likely a cigar-shaped object) traveling slowly northbound at about 6,000-8,000 ft and well over 2-3 football fields in length, going over our house (one light after another in other in fixed formation. i ran in to the house breaking things on my way and called my mom. she ran out and also saw object passing over our heads. i said: mom they are here for us, they have arrived. the electrifying feeling went though our bodies. we started waiving and jumping in joy, asking them to stop for us. indeed, the object stopped for a bit, seemingly posing for us, and then started turn with front going up. then after hanging there for 30-45  seconds, first bottom (back) light dimmed out and then the brighter light followed the first and just disappeared in front of our eyes. the whole experience lasted no more than 2-3 minutes. 

a few days later, my mother found the picture of a similar formation, which was unknowingly was taken by my on august 25, in devil���s lake wisconsin.
content.shape: Bullet,   Missile,   Cigar,   Square,   Rectagular,   Unknown
content.summary: Telepathically initiated a sighting of a large mother-ship over my house. similar formation found in earlier picture.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from my brothers house with my son around 8:15ish, i looked off to my left which would be looking south west while driving west on w. main st.As i looked up i noticed a cone shaped beam of light that was whitish in color. there seemed to be a fog or mist accompanied with the light. the object/light didn't seem to be that high up and was at about 45 degrees up from the horizon. i told my son to look at the object and he was kinda surprised to see this as we had previously seen some strange lights in the sky 2 weeks earlier. we witnessed this light and mist for maybe a min and appeared stationary then it just vanished like smoke dissipating. the light itself appeared to look like a street light kinda flat on top and round on the bottom with a cone shaped light emanating from it into the mist/fog. sorry for the crude drawing.
content.summary: Cone of light with mist

content.detailedDescription: Me and my dad were looking at a balloon in the sky, joking it was a ufo ironically and i kept looking into the sky and i saw what looked like a distant plane going really fast and i said to him look how fast that is going and it took a very sharp left then a right and made a small cursive o and flew off even faster into the distance...We were at toys r us which is 50 feet from the taco bell where my four friends and saw a ufo 9/19/09 which i reported as well
content.summary: Distant light making strange maneuvers looked like a distant plane going extremely fast

content.detailedDescription: Me and 4 of our friends were sitting outside the taco bell parking lot and one of my friends looked in the sky and said what is that? and we looked and saw a bright light hovering dropping a cone shaped light from the bright light and after 30 seconds of staring at it ,it disappeared and what looked like a a light fog or mist seemed to just float where the object was hovering...We all are overly excited and exstatic...We still do not understand what we saw...We been trying to debunk it and there is nothing we could think of or ever seen...It was the unknown
content.summary: Bright light shining with cone shaped beam shining under it surrounded by a light fog

content.detailedDescription: I was outside with my wife and children enjoying a very clear evening just past dusk.  the stars were mostly visible, but there was still a faint light from sunset left.  off to the south approx. 30-40 deg elevation appeared a bright light shining downward that was illuminating a cone directly underneath.  the night was crystal clear without any clouds so it seemed very odd that the sky should "glow" under the light almost as if there was some powder released just before the light began.  the light lasted about 20-30 sec before extinguishing.  all the while it remained motionless and did not change position or direction.  it was then extinguished, but left a very faint glimmer of a cloud in it's wake - a white area of the sky that was barley visible and seemed to keep dropping slowly earthward.  the light appeared in the vicinity of skydiving activity (a local airport serves as its base of operations), but even though i recall seeing a jump plane drop off jumpers just around dusk, that was over 30 min prior.  in fact it would have been too dark to skydive safely at the time the light was spotted and i remember looking very closely for any nearby airplane activity that might explain the light (i am a private pilot) and did not see anything nearby.  due to the position in the sky and the brief appearance, it was almsot impossible to judge distance.  it could have been a 2000-3000' in the air, but at first glance looked to be much higher in the atmosphere.  i have never seen anything that looked like this and could not think of any explaination for its occurence.  unfortunately i missed getting a photo shot by mere seconds.
content.summary: Short flash downward from light source that gave appearance of a comet tail

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were on a road trip for two weeks.  when visiting in montana, we stopped at a cute b&b called old kirby place fishing lodge near ennis, mt on the madison river in madison county.  i'm a photographer and wanted to take some photos of an iron bridge near the b&b.  we were there on august 27, 2009 and it was mid afternoon.  we spoke to the inn keeper, and he let us walk around and take photos of the property.  i took some photos of one of the lodges on the property.  it wasn't until i was home and editing my photos that i noticed something in this photograph.  to the right and above the rustic lodge is something that appears to be white and maybe metallic or gray on the bottom that is slanted at a 45 degree angle.  it somewhat looks like saucer shape because the bottom metalic side is slightly longer than the white top part.  it somewhat appears to be rectangular in shape too.  anyway, i can't figure out what it is, and thought i would send it to you guys to tell me what you think it is.  i grew up near seguin, texas, and am familiar with mufon, so you guys were the first organization i thought of contacting to help me identify this object.  could you please help me identify the object?
content.summary: I was editing photos when i arrived home from vacation, and noticed something in this photo that i can't explain.

content.detailedDescription:
Location: lancaster, pa -- backyard fireplace

the light drew our attention first.

action/motion: slow and consistent

emotions/reactions: thought it was a police helicopter, but then realized it was much larger and without any sound.

we only saw it for about eight seconds, but it appeared as a veil of light descending several-hundred feet from the sky. the light intensity was not powerful at first glance, but the source was consistent and appeared to be from a broad base (see sketch), versus a single spotlight. there were no mechanical sounds to be heard, although we thought we could hear what we believed to be a single, high-pitched, long blast sound from an air balloon. 

after eight seconds it quickly faded.
content.summary: Shaft of light coming from broad baseline in sky

content.detailedDescription:
After reporting what i saw to mufon, i put up a status about the event on my facebook and was tipped off.  what we saw was not a ufo but the international space station which is was and apparently still is viewable from my area last week.  it looks like a star with a light beam. and can be seen for about two to five minutes.  

and we thought we all saw something strange and exciting!
content.summary: Now to ruin the ufo fun for all

content.detailedDescription:
I was walking out to my garage this evening when i witnessed three blinking lights in a triangle formation to the northwest of my home. the lights were distant, however they were in the direction of bangor mtn and the borough of stroudsburg (approx 10 miles away). i called my wife outside who witnessed the lights as well. our 16 yr old son joined us as well and attempted to vire the blinking objects with his telescope. in the over 10 years that we have lived in our home, we have never witnessed such an event. the blinking lights would become dull for a few minutes, then they would all begin to blink in tandem. additionally, the triangle formation remained in one location while the stars moved as the earth rotated. after viewing the lights for about an hour, we noticed that two additional blinking light were to both the right and left of the triangle in the distance. all the lights would blink together then become stationary. 

my wife is an assistant principal at a local high school, i am a retired police officer, and now a federal agent with the irs. our son is a honor student. we are not mentally unfit or challenged. both my wife and i possess ms degrees, and my wife is nearly complete with her ph.D.

i am providing our backgrounds because i can't stress enough of what we witnessed. i would be happy to assist with any questions you may have. additionally, there was a news report on the 10pm news of odd lights in the sky over the lehigh valley and berks co, areas of pa. this was seen on wfmz tv chan 69 in allentown, pa. 

thank you!
content.summary: Small triangle formation blinking

content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i came home from my birthday dinner as i pulled into the driveway me and my girlfreind saw this bright light shinning down like a big flash light..I do live near dulles airport but it was very clear out. this was no airplane or chopper. as the light went away it left a white have in the sky then dissappere. the light was out of the ordinary it was beaming down for a little bit then diminished slowly.
 ashburn,va 20147
content.summary: Beam of light  floating over ashburn,va
